_header: In a church there I can kneel / This ender day in on morning
_description: Deo gracias — eleven 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) with this refrain

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
IN a Chirche þer I con knelÞis ender day in on
                    Morwenynge…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And sitte a mong his seintes hendeAnd þer synge Deo
                        Gracias
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BLAdd22283.First Lines:
IN a chirche þere I con knelÞis ender fay in on
                    Morwenynge…
BLAdd22283.Last Lines:
…And sitte amonges his seyntes hendeAnd þere synge Deo
                    gracias
BLAdd22283.Attributed Title: Explicit a songe of Deo gracias (f. 129rb)

Digital Facsimile of British Library MS Add. 22283 (‘Simeon’).

NLS1931.First Lines:
iN a kyrke as can kneleÞis endyr dey be a wode sydeMe
                    lyked þo serwys wonder wele…
NLS1931.Last Lines:
…And sitte a mong his seyntes hendeAnd in þat place syng
                        deo gracias

Hardman,  Phillipa.

            2000.
